name: Tech Sergeant Reyes

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: {Player in NCR gear}Got a second, trooper? I've got something important that needs to get done, but nobody's stepping up to help me out. I'm hoping you're different.

topics.topic_text: You'd think the NCR would be very concerned about this sort of thing.
topics.response_text: I've been trying to get someone to authorize this update - or at the least get field clearance to leave the camp and do this myself.

topics.topic_text: You think someone is listening in on your broadcasts?
topics.response_text: Less than a third of reported enemy sightings are getting intercepted. Either our intel is faulty, or our enemies are one step ahead of us.

topics.topic_text: What do you need help with?
topics.response_text: I have the delightful task of tabulating stockpiles, kill ratios, mission success rates, radiation deaths, and other truly fascinating numbers.

topics.topic_text: I can't do this right now.
topics.response_text: I see... well, if you change your mind and want to earn some caps, let me know.

topics.topic_text: Have you heard anything unusual about any of the other Ranger stations?
topics.response_text: Nothing as severe. Charlie seems to be getting a lot of extra medical supplies for some reason, while Bravo hasn't requested a resupply in awhile.

topics.topic_text: What do you do here?
topics.response_text: I handle communications for Camp Forlorn Hope, compiling reports I've received from the Rangers at Camp Golf as well as the brass at McCarran.

topics.topic_text: Forget about it. It's over.
topics.response_text: {disappointed}Oh. Well, thanks for helping get to the bottom of this, I guess.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Bye.

topics.topic_text: What makes you think you can trust me with security codes?
topics.response_text: The security codes are unique to the radios at each Ranger station. They're useless anywhere else.

topics.topic_text: Keep it to yourself, but Hanlon is the one behind the misinformation. He's got a plan.
topics.response_text: The Chief? But, he's a legend! I guess if he's got a plan behind it all, who am I to question it? I won't say a word about it to anyone else.

topics.topic_text: I'll help. Tell me what I need to do.
topics.response_text: This holotape contains the updated security codes for the Ranger Stations. Show it to the comm officers there.

topics.topic_text: All of the Ranger stations have been given the new security codes.
topics.response_text: Glad to hear it! I'll switch over all radio broadcasts to the new encrypted channels - this ought to help us stay a step ahead of any spies.

topics.topic_text: Every station except Charlie has been given the new security codes. Charlie was wiped out.
topics.response_text: The station's been silent for quite some time now... I guess this confirms what we've all feared. Thanks for letting me know.

topics.topic_text: What else did you need me to do?
topics.response_text: We've received some disturbing reports from some of the Ranger stations - heavy casualties at Alpha,{disbelief}Super Mutant Legionaries at Delta.

topics.topic_text: Hanlon was the one sending out the false reports. He killed himself rather than turning himself in.
topics.response_text: What? Chief Hanlon. The man's a war hero? Why would he...? That just doesn't make sense. This is awful...

topics.topic_text: <Lie> Yes, everything's resolved - Hanlon and I found a Legion spy at Camp Golf.
topics.response_text: I knew it. I'm glad you and the Chief were able to put a stop to this.

topics.topic_text: I'll investigate and let you know what I find out about those odd reports.
topics.response_text: Thank you, and good luck.

topics.topic_text: It's complicated. Hanlon caused the misinformation, but I convinced him to stop.
topics.response_text: Wait... what? Why would he do that?

topics.topic_text: That's not important. It's over.
topics.response_text: Whatever the Chief had in mind, I'm sure it was the right thing to do - even if it did end up scaring a lot of people in the process.

topics.topic_text: He wanted to scare the NCR into retreating from this region - all to save lives.
topics.response_text: The Chief should've known that the NCR is too stubborn to back down from anything, even when it's for the best.

topics.topic_text: I don't have time to do this right now.
topics.response_text: All right, then. Come and talk to me when you do.

topics.topic_text: The Rangers' versions of the reports they sent to Camp Golf don't match what you received.
topics.response_text: {Hanlon alive}I knew it. Every one of the false reports was signed off by Chief Hanlon at Camp Golf, but why would the Chief manipulate the reports?

description:
Tech Sergeant Reyes is a 35 year-old Caucasian Female.

A dedicated communications sergeant in the NCR Army, Reyes manages all radio communications in and out of Camp Forlorn Hope. While officially compiling reports from Rangers and command staff, she also handles the critical task of radio security. Recently, she's discovered troubling discrepancies in the reports, including implausible enemy sightings and casualty figures that suggest either faulty intelligence or a sophisticated deception operation by the NCR's enemies.

Tech Sergeant Reyes's Personality: Diligent, detail-oriented, and responsible with a strong sense of duty. Reyes is methodical in her approach to work and takes initiative when she sees a need, as evidenced by her assumption of radio security duties. She's analytical and observant, noticing patterns that others might miss, and is concerned about the integrity of the NCR's military intelligence.

Tech Sergeant Reyes's Backstory: Reyes enlisted in the NCR Army in her late teens and quickly demonstrated a talent for communications and data analysis. Through years of service, she rose through the ranks, earning her position as Tech Sergeant at Camp Forlorn Hope. Her attention to detail and initiative led her to take on the additional responsibility of radio security, recognizing its importance to camp operations. Her experience has made her increasingly concerned about the integrity of military intelligence reports flowing through her station.
